Notes: Kitty says: if this is available then the below information is presumably not necessary, but it will be fairly rare, especially in the beginning, that a link is readily available and so the below is necessary; Kitty asks: should this be zooarchaeological context name, or should this actually be extended to be the specific context name for either paleo or zoo specimens? or is "bed" the specific location of recovery of the paleo specimen? Description: various thesauri?  http://vocab.getty.edu/page/aat/300017826 in the Getty Art and Architecture Thesaurus
Notes: Kitty says: my concern with all of these is that there is no central place to go for them - once datasets start coming in from all over the world, there will be various sources for URIs - these work for the area I research

Kitty says: in some ways this may seem to overlap with the chronometry above, but in many cases it is a looser term that approximates the occupational period of an area by a culture - whereas the chronometry is a specific date that relies on quantifiable data (at least that's my distinction)
